definition: to meddle/to be a "nosy Parker"/to be too inquisitive about other people's business
surname Guan

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards
idle/unoccupied/leisure
variant of 間|间[jian1]
variant of 間|间[jian4]
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
meddling in other people's business
Mind your own business!/Don't interfere!

sentences.english: I hope you don't think I'm nosey .
sentences.chinese: 希望你不認爲我好管閒事。

sentences.english: I've always found her unbearably nosey.
sentences.chinese: 我發覺她總愛管閒事真讓人受不了。

sentences.english: Those busybodies always seemed to have some-thing to gossip about.
sentences.chinese: 薩拉是個好管閒事的人，老是打聽別人的事。

sentences.english: Her neighbors don't like her because she is a busybody .
sentences.chinese: 她的鄰居們不喜歡她，因爲她好管閒事。

sentences.english: That's the interfering chap I ever see.
sentences.chinese: 我還沒見過那麼愛管閒事的小子。

sentences.english: Monkey, seeing that the boy was actually a demon in disguise, told his master not to bother.
sentences.chinese: 悟空認出那是妖怪變的，叫師父少管閒事。

sentences.english: A person who meddles or pries into the affairs of others.
sentences.chinese: 另外有個矮小的，好管閒事的人拉他的胳膊。

sentences.english: I moved becasue I can't put up with that officious landlady any longer.
sentences.chinese: 我搬家是因爲我再也受不了那個好管閒事的女房東了。
他是一個愛管閒事的人。

sentences.english: He pokes his nose into everything.
I do not want to be a busybody, but there is something you need to know.
sentences.chinese: 我不想管閒事，但有些事情你應該知道。

sentences.english: I like listening to their private phone calls, in a nosey sort of way .
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡聽他們的私人電話，有點好管閒事的意味。

sentences.english: I moved because I can't put up with that officious landlady any longer.
sentences.chinese: 我搬家是因爲我再也受不了那個好管閒事的女房東了。

sentences.english: Well, i'll learn her how to meddle .
sentences.chinese: 好啦，我得教訓教訓她怎麼去管閒事。
你是福爾摩斯，愛管閒事的人。
沒人喜歡愛管閒事的人。

definition: to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
fair and reasonable (idiom); sensible/standing to reason
to make a clear difference between what one likes and what one hates/to have well-defined likes and dislikes
to be self-interested
lit. trifling destroys the will (idiom); infatuation with fine details prevents one making progress/excessive attention to trivia saps the will
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
fickle (woman)
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
temperamental/moody
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
competitive/ambitious and aggressive/to desire to beat others
compassion/empathetic
lit. knifes piercing both sides (idiom)/fig. to attach a great importance to friendship, up to the point of being able to sacrifice oneself for it
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
